column5: Congrats Joey and good for you. Takes a strong person.
Excellent news. Great to hear you're still going strong. A role model for others for sure. Congrats.
Wow, such kind words, I'm Verklempt!  I'm just happy I made it.  Thanks again one and all, you all hold a special place in my heart  Joey

Cant believe I did not see this till now.. my mind has been preoccupied.. I am extremely proud of you Joey, you faced your demon head on and survived.. your one strong women.. You are an inspiration to us all...  Luv yah toots,  Gerritt.
Sis and I are very proud of you Joey. ****HUGS****

When we first met last year and you told me the story, I was amazed at how strong a person you are!  Congrats on this huge milestone.  From what you told me, things were not good.....I'm glad you stepped up, cause OFC would NOT be the same place without you.  See you Monday at the Mercer thing!
Congrats Joey It takes a strong person to do what you have done I have the utmost respect for you   Rick
Well done Joey!
So, today's the day! Joey, you're doing very well. I've never been prouder of you. HUGS.
Same from me my dear.... keep it going for years to come, it suits you well.

Awwwww, jeeeeeez, thanks hon.  I couldn't have done it without some help from my friends tho.  So yes, today is 2 years sober for me.  On the wagon as its called and I'm still strapped in  I'd really like to thank some OFNr's for their help.  GaryV was there at the beginning, as was Beans and BigCliff with their kind words and wisdom.  Lew and Wayne and Chuck make G2G's alot easier on me, and sometimes Art  Roy, you've been there for me all the way and encouraged me and even offered not to drink in front of me.  Spiel, thanks for the card and calls and words of encouragement!  DouG, thanks for the Many calls  And of course Paul, my rock, who has been there through the whole thing and has virtually quit himself to make it easier for me (except at G2G's   ).  Hey, he has an image to live up to, right Big Chief     Seriously, you've been awesome hon.  So thanks to you all and here's to many more happy, healthy years ahead.  Joey
Congrats Joey,  Maureen
Very proud of you kiddo & there's always a place at my picnic table for you
Congrats Joey  - I watched a very good friend hit bottom, and then something clicked in her and she took control.  I admire her and I admire you.   All the best to you.
WTG Joey...  Keep it going girl...
Well done Joey and a well deserved congrats!
Congrats Joey, not a small feat to manage you should be very proud of yourself.
Way to go Joey few things feel as good as making a  decision and sticking by it. I am proud to know that I helped you get to were you wanted to be.   Art

A true accomplishment Joey, congratulations! A close friend and former co-worker just celebrated his second anniversary. He is going through some tough times right now as his mid-twenties son passed away yesterday in the hospital. I'm hoping we (family and friends) can help him get through this trying time. -Brian
Congratulations Joey!!!!!!!!!!! Its shows true strength Paul good on you for being the backboard
Congrats Joey.Keep it up.Its not an easy thing to do but it just keeps getting easier and easier every day.I know. Dan
Love ya J, keep it up.
Congrats girl... Monique and I are proud of ya.
Congrats Joey
Congratulations Joey!!   Paul, wtg and helping out and being supportive!
Congratulations Joey.  There's a lot of love for you on this board.
As mentioned after a few months time will start to fly and turn into years......and the best part is you remember all of it going by.  Congratulations on your two years!
And not only that...you get better lookin' every time I see you !  Congrats to you and Paul...
Congrats...
Congratulations!!!
That was a scary time for a while, Joey.  We are all proud that you stepped up, squared up and dug in.  Congratulations to a fine, fine lady.
Congratulations Joey. Keep up the good work. Never  knew, but have even more respect for you now. I'm sure you're an inspiration to many.
